External_Reference.description: Barucci, M.A., M.T. Capria, A. Coradini, and M. Fulchignoni, Classification of asteroids using G-mode analysis, Icarus 72, 304- 324, 1987.
Bus, S.J. and R.P. Binzel, Phase II of the small main-belt asteroid spectroscopic survey: A feature-based taxonomy, Icarus 158, 146- 177, 2002.
DeMeo, F., R.P. Binzel, S.M. Slivan, and S.J. Bus, An extension of the Bus asteroid taxonomy into the near-infrared, Icarus 202, 160-180, 2009.
Howell, E.S., E. Merenyi, and L.A. Lebofsky, Classification of asteroid spectra using a neural network. Journal of Geophysical Results 99, 10847-10865, 1994.
Lazzaro, D., C.A. Angeli, J.M. Carvano, T. Mothe-Diniz, R. Duffard, and M. Florczak, S3OS2: The visible spectroscopic survey of 820 asteroids, Icarus 172, 179-220, 2004.
Tedesco, E.F., J.G. Williams, D.L. Matson, G.J. Veeder, J.C. Gradie, and L.A. Lebofsky, A Three-Parameter Asteroid Taxonomy, Astron. J. 97, 580-606, 1989.
Tholen, D.J., Asteroid Taxonomic Classifcations, In 'Asteroids II' (R.P. Binzel, T. Gehrels, M.S. Matthews, Eds.), pp. 1139-1150, University of Arizona Press, Tucson, 1989.
Xu, S., R.P. Binzel, T.H. Burbine, and S.J. Bus, Small Main-belt Asteroid Spectroscopic Survey: Initial results, Icarus, 115, 1-35, 1995.

Table_Character.description:
This data set contains taxonomic classifications from the following sources:
Tholen, D. J. 1989. Asteroid taxonomic classifcations. In Asteroids II (R. P. Binzel, T. Gehrels, and M. S. Matthews, Eds.), pp. 1139-1150. Univ. of Arizona Press, Tucson. [THOLEN1989]
Barucci, M. A., M. T. Capria, A. Coradini, and M. Fulchignoni 1987. Classification of asteroids using G-mode analysis. Icarus 72, 304-324. [BARUCCIETAL1987]
Tedesco, E. F., J. G. Williams, D. L. Matson, G. J. Veeder, J. C. Gradie, and L. A. Lebofsky 1989. A three-parameter asteroid taxonomy. Astron. J. 97, 580-606. [TEDESCOETAL1989]
Howell, E. S., E. Merenyi, and L. A. Lebofsky 1994. Classification of asteroid spectra using a neural network. J. Geophys. Res. 99, 10847-10865. [HOWELLETAL1994]
Xu, S., R. P. Binzel, T. H. Burbine, S. J. Bus 1995. Small main-belt asteroid spectroscopic survey: Initial Results. Icarus 115, 1-35. [XUETAL1995]
Bus, S.J. and R.P. Binzel 2002. Phase II of the small main-belt asteroid spectroscopic survey: A feature-based taxonomy. Icarus 158, 146-177. [BUSETAL2002]
Lazzaro, D., C.A. Angeli, J.M. Carvano, T. Mothe-Diniz, R. Duffard, and M. Florczak, S3OS2: The visible spectroscopic survey of 820 asteroids, Icarus 172, 179-220, 2004. [LAZZAROETAL2004]
DeMeo, F., R.P. Binzel, S.M. Slivan, and S.J. Bus, An extension of the Bus asteroid taxonomy into the near-infrared, Icarus 202, 160-180, 2009. [DEMEOETAL2009]

Field_Character.name: AST_NUMBER
Field_Character.description: Asteroid number, if any. This file is sorted on asteroid number, with unnumbered asteroids listed at the end by provisional designation.

Field_Character.name: AST_NAME
Field_Character.description: Asteroid name, if any

Field_Character.name: PROV_ID
Field_Character.description: Asteroid provisional designation. This is included only for those objects that were unnumbered as of the original compilation.

Field_Character.name: THOLEN_CLASS
Field_Character.description: Taxonomic classification according to the method of Tholen (1984, 1989). An entry with the value of '***' indicates an object with unusual colors not classifiable into any of the defined classes.

Field_Character.name: THOLEN_PARAM
Field_Character.description:
Parameters used for the Tholen (1984, 1989) classification. The number indicates how many color indices were used in the classification, and the letter(s) which parameters were used in addition to (or instead of) color indices to arrive at the classification:
number the number of color indices used G groundbased radiometric albedo I IRAS radiometric albedo A An albedo of unspecified source was used to eliminate some other possible classes based on the spectrum alone. S The classification is based on a medium resolution spectrum published by Chapman and Gaffey (1979). s The classification is based on a high-resolution spectrum by Xu et al (1995) or Bus and Binzel (2002).

Field_Character.name: BARUCCI_CLASS
Field_Character.description: Taxonomic classification according to the method of Barucci et al. (1987)

Field_Character.name: BARUCCI_PARAM
Field_Character.description:
Parameters used for the Barucci et al. (1987) classification. The number indicates how many color indices were used in the classification, and the letter(s) which parameters were used in addition to (or instead of) color indices to arrive at the classification:
number the number of color indices used G groundbased radiometric albedo I IRAS radiometric albedo A An albedo of unspecified source was used to eliminate some other possible classes based on the spectrum alone. S The classification is based on a medium resolution spectrum published by Chapman and Gaffey (1979). s The classification is based on a high-resolution spectrum by Xu et al (1995) or Bus and Binzel (2002).

Field_Character.name: TEDESCO_CLASS
Field_Character.description: Taxonomic classification according to the method of Tedesco et al. (1989)

Field_Character.name: TEDESCO_PARAM
Field_Character.description:
Parameters used for the Tedesco et al. (1989) classification. The number indicates how many color indices were used in the classification, and the letter(s) which parameters were used in addition to (or instead of) color indices to arrive at the classification:
number the number of color indices used G groundbased radiometric albedo I IRAS radiometric albedo A An albedo of unspecified source was used to eliminate some other possible classes based on the spectrum alone. S The classification is based on a medium resolution spectrum published by Chapman and Gaffey (1979). s The classification is based on a high-resolution spectrum by Xu et al (1995) or Bus and Binzel (2002).

Field_Character.name: HOWELL_CLASS
Field_Character.description: Taxonomic classification according to the Howell (1994) method

Field_Character.name: HOWELL_PARAM
Field_Character.description:
Parameters used for the Howell et al. (1994) classification. The number indicates how many color indices were used in the classification, and the letter(s) which parameters were used in addition to (or instead of) color indices to arrive at the classification:
number the number of color indices used G groundbased radiometric albedo I IRAS radiometric albedo A An albedo of unspecified source was used to eliminate some other possible classes based on the spectrum alone. S The classification is based on a medium resolution spectrum published by Chapman and Gaffey (1979). s The classification is based on a high-resolution spectrum by Xu et al (1995) or Bus and Binzel (2002).
The Howell et al. (1994) classifications are all based on a combination of 8-color (Zellner et al. 1985) and 52-color (Bell et al. 1988) data, resampled at 65 points to provide a more uniform wavelength sampling.

Field_Character.name: SMASS_CLASS
Field_Character.description: Taxonomic classification based on the spectra of the SMASS survey (Xu et al. 1995)

Field_Character.name: SMASS_PARAM
Field_Character.description:
Parameters used for the Xu et al. (1995) (SMASS) classification. The number indicates how many color indices were used in the classification, and the letter(s) which parameters were used in addition to (or instead of) color indices to arrive at the classification:
number the number of color indices used G groundbased radiometric albedo I IRAS radiometric albedo A An albedo of unspecified source was used to eliminate some other possible classes based on the spectrum alone. S The classification is based on a medium resolution spectrum published by Chapman and Gaffey (1979). s The classification is based on a high-resolution spectrum by Xu et al. (1995) or Bus and Binzel (2002).

Field_Character.name: BUS_CLASS
Field_Character.description: Taxonomic classification based on the spectra of the SMASSII survey (Bus and Binzel 2002). An entry with a value of '***' indicates the object has an unusual spectrum not classifiable into any of the defined classes.

Field_Character.name: BUS_PARAM
Field_Character.description:
Parameters used for the Bus and Binzel (2002) (SMASSII) classification. The number indicates how many color indices were used in the classification, and the letter(s) which parameters were used in addition to (or instead of) color indices to arrive at the classification:
number the number of color indices used G groundbased radiometric albedo I IRAS radiometric albedo A An albedo of unspecified source was used to eliminate some other possible classes based on the spectrum alone. S The classification is based on a medium resolution spectrum published by Chapman and Gaffey (1979). s The classification is based on a high-resolution spectrum by Xu et al. (1995) or Bus and Binzel (2002).

Field_Character.name: S3OS2_CLASS_TH
Field_Character.description: S3OS2 taxonomic classification according to the method of [THOLEN1984] (Tholen Ph.D. thesis). For details of how the method was applied, see [LAZZAROETAL2004] (Icarus 172, 179-220.)

Field_Character.name: S3OS2_CLASS_BB
Field_Character.description: S3OS2 taxonomic classification according to the method of [BUS&BINZEL2002] (Icarus 158, 146-177.) For details of how the method was applied, see [LAZZAROETAL2004] (Icarus 172, 179-220.)

Field_Character.name: BUS_DEMEO_CLASS
Field_Character.description: Bus-DeMeo taxonomic classification, from DeMeo et al. 2009. Note that a 'w' following the taxonomic class indicates a slope greater than 0.25, and a ':' indicates a questionable classification because of low quality/questionable data.

Field_Character.name: DEMEO_REF_CODE
Field_Character.description:
This code indicates the published sources of the observations that produced the Bus-DeMeo taxonomic classification.
a - Visible: Bus (1999), Bus and Binzel (2002a), Bus and Binzel (2002b) Near-IR: DeMeo et al. (2009)
b - Visible: Xu (1994), Xu et al. (1995) Near-IR: DeMeo et al. (2009)
c - Visible: Burbine (2000), Burbine and Binzel (2002) Near-IR: DeMeo et al. (2009)
d - Visible: Binzel et al. (2004c) Near-IR: DeMeo et al. (2009)
e - Visible and Near-IR: DeMeo et al. (2009)
f - Visible: Binzel et al. (2004b) Near-IR: DeMeo et al. (2009)
g - Visible: Binzel et al. (2001) Near-IR: DeMeo et al. (2009)
h - Visible: Bus (1999), Bus and Binzel (2002a), Bus and Binzel (2002b) NEAR-IR: Binzel et al. (2004a)
i - Visible: Bus (1999), Bus and Binzel (2002a), Bus and Binzel (2002b) NEAR-IR: Rivkin et al. (2005)

Field_Character.name: COMMENT
Field_Character.description:
Five entries have a notation in the comment field, indicating a comment about the identification of the object. The comments are given here:
The classification for (152) Atala in the original reference is based on data that have been found to be inconsistent with other observations. The current belief is that this object may have been misidentified during the course of the Eight-Color Asteroid Survey, therefore the classification has been changed to 'I' to reflect inconsistent data.
The classifications for (2151) Hadwiger and (2422) Perovskaya are based on UBV colors published by Bowell et al. (1979), where they are identified as 1975 EA and 1975 GB, respectively.
The classification for 1975 RC is also based on UBV colors published by Bowell et al. (1979), where it is identified as 1975 U2, which is not a proper provisional designation. Efforts to determine the correct identity of this object revealed that 1975 U2 appears to be a designation assigned by C.-I. Lagerkvist for his own personal use. Users should be warned that the identification of 1975 U2 as 1975 RC may be incorrect.
The classification for (5145) Pholus listed in the Tholen classification column was taken from Mueller et al. (1992).
